qas.question: A description of the Buddhist path may have been as simplistic as what term?
The description of buddhism was broadened resulting in what path?

context: According to Vetter, the description of the Buddhist path may initially have been as simple as the term "<a0_0>the middle way<a0_0/>". In time, this short description was elaborated, resulting in the description of the <a1_0>eightfold<a1_0/> path.
